page.title: 10MERRYTHOUGHT TOYS IRONBRIDGE
page.content: The company was started by Mr Holmes' grandfather in 1930, in a building which had belonged to Coalbrookdale Company. 60 people are employed at Merrythought Toys. The jobs are designing, cutting, sewing, stuffing, finishing and packing. The best selling toy is the green hippopotamus. The special line is a 6'6"teddy bear. The toy they have made for the longest is the parrot, it was first made in 1931. 25% of the toys are exported, the main countries are America, Canada and Australia. They make 600 toys a day and 12,000 a month. Merrythought means a wishbone so it is their trademark. A famous Merrythought teddy, Mr Woppit, survived Donald Campbell's fatal waterspeed crash. His daughter Gina took the bear with her when she tried to break the record.
